file_content.text: Doctor Lokin.
Cipher. I'd like to make a proposal.
For five minutes, you and I pretend to trust one another. We lay our cards on the table.
No lies. No hidden recorders. Just truth.
You have a deal. How do we start?
Agreed.
Why don't you start by telling me why you're on Taris.
You go first.
You don't expect me to fall for that.
Are you joking?
This isn't a ploy, I assure you.
As I told you before, I came to Taris to further my studies of the rakghouls. Ki Sazen stole research I desired.
I've been studying the rakghouls for some time. I came to Taris to review the research of others--the same research Ki Sazen stole.
My goal was to perfect a custom strain of the rakghoul virus. Keyed to my own genetic structure, it currently allows free reversion between human and rakghoul forms.
I don't understand. You wanted to become a rakghoul?
Why?
You told me you were sent by Imperial Intelligence to catalog Nasan Godera's lab.
Did Keeper approve this?
That was a lie. I do officially work for Intelligence, but this was a personal project.
Then again, you weren't sent here by Imperial Intelligence either.
You thought you'd turn yourself into a monster. Naturally.
Right... so you're crazy.
There are advantages. Consider an unarmed operative who could enter a secure location... and grow teeth. I'm merely a test subject.
Of course, our superiors wouldn't agree with my choice of "personal projects." It seems both of us lied about being sent here by Imperial Intelligence.
Keeper gave me this assignment herself.
You're wrong.
That's a very interesting theory. Maybe you should explain.
What makes you say that?
I don't think too much elaboration is wise, but... your unusual contacts? Your search for the Ultrawave Transmitter?
I don't like being accused of treason, doctor.
You're on thin ice.
Of course. Despite your... unusual choice of contacts, and your search for the Ultrawave Transmitter.
I understand, Cipher, that working without official sanction can be a necessary evil.
But given what we know about one another, I think I ought to stay close to you. An alliance rather than mutual destruction.
We keep an eye on each other, and our secrets stay hidden. Maybe we'll even get some work done.
Very well.
I'm not sure I understand what you're asking.
You want to join up?
We could both go to our superiors and expose one another's secrets. But who does that help?
You let me take my research onto your ship, and I'll contribute my share.
Besides, with Ki Sazen dealt with, I need something to keep myself occupied.
I don't like you, and I certainly don't trust you. Why would I let you aboard my ship?
You're smug and a liar.
You're not my ideal company either, but trust and friendship aren't necessary for a beneficial partnership.
You and I could be enemies. This is vastly more convenient.
You keep my secrets, and I'll keep yours. In the meantime, we work together.
All right, you can join.
There's room in the crew compartment, but don't get comfortable.
This is only temporary.
You can join my team. But one misstep and you're floating through space.
If you step out of line...
I'll gather my belongings and meet you on board.
Oh, and one last thing--about the Ultrawave Transmitter. You know that Nasan Godera was notorious for hiding secrets in his devices?
Encrypted codes, maps to lost projects--just something I heard. I'll see you shortly.
If he tries to talk to me, I'm tearing his head off. Otherwise, I'm good with this.
He's an odd man. And there's something in his eyes... we'll watch him.
I don't know what he was talking about, sir. But I hope you know what you're doing.
Cipher, this is Doctor Lokin. I hope you're receiving this, because I'm not going to get another chance.
I'm inside Ki Sazen's base. She and her people are housed in an abandoned tunnel system in the main Republic compound. The Ultrawave Transmitter is here.
When you arrive, I'll do my best to cause a ruckus. But please hurry.
It isn't just my life at stake--there is a mission to attend to as well.
While you're visiting rakghoul sensors, I'm sure I can keep busy here.
If I didn't have a sensor net, I'd use the settlers' sensors along the military front lines. Full of data your friends will want--unless you claim it first.
You're a useful man to have around.
That's exactly what I needed.
Thank you. And I'm not finished.
Should I expect Republic resistance?
How bad is it out there?
Almost certainly, though I have something that might help.
Assuming you're right, I have a Nikto cult to confront. Be seeing you.
Time to kill.
One last thing before you go.
My own recipe of kolto-derivative combat stimulants--medicine to make you more deadly. Against your enemies, you'll need it.
So we grab the data before the Nikto do, and shoot the ones in our way. Good times.
Now let's hope we can keep the data out of Ki Sazen's hands.
Not looking forward to fighting more of Ki Sazen's servants, but we can't let them get their data, can we?
Cipher, back with hardly a scratch!
And here I am, practically electrocuting myself on Nasan Godera's equipment. How embarrassing.
I know the Jedi's plans.
What exactly have you been doing?
How are things here?
Still piecing together this and that. Nasan Godera may have been brilliant, but he was not a studious record keeper.
So, any luck finding our Jedi?
Ki Sazen is trying to use the Ultrawave Transmitter to control rakghouls.
Here's what I found.
But she needs data on rakghoul colony movements. I want to stop her servants from getting it.
My. That is worrisome.
Very little progress, I'm afraid. However, I do need an answer:
Not really.
I report my findings to Keeper. All you need to do is answer a question:
That's classified information.
How do I stop an enemy from acquiring data on rakghoul colony movements?
I need to know one thing: If you were after data on rakghoul colony movements, where would you go?
Let's get to the point.
What a very odd thing to ask. Cipher... do you plan on defecting to the rakghouls?
Ki Sazen's agents are gathering research. I have to find them.
I need to intercept the Nikto.
You have a strange sense of humor.
Very funny.
It's a strange world. But in any case...
Just answer the question.
Of course, of course.
Rakghouls are a hobby of mine. If I wanted rakghoul colony data, I'd set up a sensor net to collect field readings.
Cipher! I think we have our lead.
I'm receiving faint signals from an old Tarisian transport station. Were I a betting man, I'd say our bio-research lab--our Jedi's next target--is in there.
Any idea where Sazen is now?
What about the Jedi herself?
None, and I can't even say whether she'll visit the facility personally.
That's where your field expertise comes in. I look forward to your findings.
Tell me about this lab.
Nothing pertinent. I understand the lab itself was built by one Doctor Dorant, departed.
I'm off to find my victims.
I have the utmost confidence in you.
I don't know whether the Jedi and her people have found the lab yet, so do be cautious. I look forward to hearing what you find.
I recommend you move swiftly.
This laboratory belonged to a man named Nasan Godera.
Utterly brilliant, invented everything from durable plastifoam to the Death Mark laser, but his relationship with the Republic is... rocky.
By the time we captured this sector, he was already gone. I came to catalog the contents of his lab--and I wasn't the first.
If you have any evidence, I need to see it.
You found the Jedi, then?
My sources reported there was a raid here.
That doesn't surprise me.
You have good sources. Watch.
Go back to Nasan Godera--what happened to him?
Where's the scientist now?
Back in Republic space, but the laboratory hasn't been empty. Watch.
Don't waste my time.
Watch this.
Is that the last of the defenses?
Yes, Mistress Sazen. So far as we are aware.
Good. Stay on your guard and destroy the monitors. Then find the device.
They stole research, equipment and something Nasan Godera called an Ultrawave Transmitter. I haven't a clue what it does.
I suggest we pool resources. A Fixer and a Cipher, investigating a thieving Jedi for Imperial Intelligence.
If we can't trust each other, who can we trust?
Let's cooperate.
My thoughts exactly.
What was the research they took? And the Ultrawave Transmitter....
Tell me about what she stole.
...transmits something called an "ultrawave." Without the laboratory files, I can't do more.
I appreciate the offer, doctor. But why don't you tell me what you know, and I'll get out of your way.
I work better alone.
If you insist.
This wasn't the only recent raid on a science facility. This planet attracts brilliance, and someone has been purloining databanks across the ruins.
With your assistance, I might have been able to predict the Jedi's next target. But if you insist on working separately....
All right, Doctor Lokin. What do you suggest we do?
You really are persistent.
You can assist, but I run this operation every step of the way.
I'm in charge. Got it?
I'm sure our superiors would approve.
I'll crush your skull against that console if you don't cooperate.
I should force you to talk.
Please! That isn't necessary. Of course I'll help you.
There's an abandoned bio-research facility somewhere in rakghoul territory. I don't have coordinates, but you should be able to triangulate its signal.
If the Jedi follows her pattern, you can intercept her there. All I need is a few scans to point you on your way.
Based on the pattern, I suspect the Jedi's next target is an abandoned bio-research facility near a red-level rakghoul colony. We can find it together.
If you've got a plan, let's hear it.
What do you propose?
There must be a reason she's going after these places.
Why would she want research?
That's what we need to discover.
Nothing happens without my approval. Understood?
Okay, but I'm in charge.
Cipher, I'm a technician. What would I possibly do?
You should be able to locate the facility by triangulating its signal from the swamps. I'll correlate the data; you intercept the Jedi.
So you're hanging out here? With the corpses and the rakghouls?
Will you be safe here? Without your security team....
How very kind. I assure you, I'll be fine.
You're just going to stay? With the dead bodies?
It is my burden.
Here's the triangulation device. Give my regards to the toxic swamp.
I've seen spice dens cleaner than this.
Is this a lab or a mass grave?
Look at this place. Maybe they should've bombed it after all.
You can lower your weapon--there are no rakghouls in here.
The late Private Ralan dispatched the last of them before succumbing.
Cipher Nine, Imperial Intelligence. You must be Doctor Lokin.
I saw your distress call.
Yes--official designation "Fixer Fifteen." How good to meet you.
What about the security team? Did any of them make it?
Are there any other survivors?
Unfortunately, no. The rakghouls took us by surprise; there weren't supposed to be colonies in this area.
This place isn't safe. You need to leave before the rakghouls come back.
Get out while you can.
Oh, I don't think that's likely. We're off their normal migratory paths, and whatever anomaly brought them here has long since passed.
I'm Fixer Fifteen, by the way. You can call me Doctor Lokin.
Watcher Four assigned me here for a cleanup operation. I assume you're here for a similar reason?
My orders are to find a Jedi called Ki Sazen. I'm told she's been here.
I'm hunting a Jedi.
Isn't that interesting? Follow me. Mind the bodies.
What sort of cleanup operation?
Cleanup operation?
I'll show you. Mind the bodies.
I can't give out details. Keeper's orders.
My mission is classified.
Of course. But I'm sure we can work together--follow me, and mind the bodies.
I'll be with you in just a moment.
